title: Is it wrong to feel frustrated?
body:
I'm in Silver 4. Just wanna let you guys know. 

Anyway, this is my 3rd ranked game after finishing provisionals, our jg, Lee Sin, lost to their jg Yi after he finished blue side and went for the scuttler. Next, he went to red and didn't even check the bush there while fighting the red buff monster (Brambleback) and got killed by the Yi who was in the bush. He tried to run away and smited the red for health but still got killed. Complained about smite not working but it clearly did in the replay that I watched. Lee then rage quit after that. He was just at lv 3. After a few min to see if he comes back, team then decided to "open mid". It was just jg that died 2 times at that time. No death from other lanes. 

This is just my 3rd ranked game after finishing provisionals and experiencing this, I don't have much hope to rank at all unless it's with a premade team. Anyway, just gotta get it out of my system. Thanks for listening to my rant!

This is a typical silver game.
Nothing to see here.
You need to destroy your lane opponent at level 1 and make sure you tilt the ENEMY team before your team starts feeding.  1st bloods and level 1 deaths tilt everyone.  That's part of the way to climb out of silver (besides warding, proper lane control, don't miss uncontested minions, don't overpush a lane if the enemy jungler is probably around you, learn when to push and then roam to help another lane if you feel you can get them ahead.  Don't fall behind on CS.  Kill towers and dragons and buy pink wards.  Don't chase enemies through an unwarded jungle.  Don't overstay in a lane after taking a turret.

This will get you to plat easily.

another good tactic is to specifically target their jungler because everyone loves to blame jungle for their own shortcomings so getting their jg to feed early spills everywhere on the enemy team

> another good tactic is to specifically target their jungler because everyone loves to blame jungle for their own shortcomings so getting their jg to feed early spills everywhere on the enemy team

This is an excellent idea, however this requires good vision control AND another laner or your jungler (depending on if you are the laner or jungler) to be winning lane enough to be able to roam.  Yes it's usually the jungler that is the most toxic person in games, so targeting him is a great way to tilt the entire enemy team, assuming YOUR laners aren't all losing lane solo.

Pick graves->Fight him at scuttle/2nd buff -> profit
All it needs from team is 1 ward really because 90% of time you just know what buff they are starting
And you really think lanes collapse in silver at 1st clear? xD
You can feel frustrated, but that doesn't mean you get to lash out.
What if they lashed out at you because you were still trying to play the game while they just stand around?
Mute them and play on. If you feel they went too far, report after the game.

nope.
as long as you aren't making it apparent to your team.
